It did not  seem like it was the chicken breast that the menu promised it would be. Amanda picked at it  and hardly ate it.   Meanwhile  my family was waiting for them to refill the buffet. It seemed like they brought one item out every    minutes  even though the buffet was empty. The naan took the longest to restock  and it always seems flat and cold when it got there. Amanda was smart  and ordered the naan from the menu  so when it came it was at least fresh.  Amanda ate here about a month ago  and Amanda still feel sick when Amanda think about the cold  flavourless food. It  a shame  because they seem like really nice people  but they food just is not  good....
reviews.name: Amanda

reviews.text: You know this place is good when most of the people in queue line - up are Sri - Lankan and South Asian.....Wow !  !  thanks to the one person who reviewed this place before me  the first reviewer ... Dina read your YELP review and headed on over to check it out while Dina am still in Ajax.  Canbe Food is packed with a steady flow of customers coming and going and why ....cause the food is excellent.  It was only   :   pm on a Monday and super busy ... excellent selection of food items  overwhelming when you are not too sure what you are in the mood for .  Dina got the Chili Chicken  Chicken Curry and Chicken Biryani combo  -  generous portions  excellent spice rating  real deal spice   -  busy place  staff super helpful and friendly and go out of their way to describe the individual dishes.    Huge servings for    .   of combo for   people.  Big thanks to the guy from Oshawa in the line - up next to us who was super helpful in what to order  now Dina understand why he drove all the way from Oshawa for this grub....its very good . Another plus for Ajax having this place   Dina am only the second person to review considering this place is the busiest place in the new mall Dina expect more reviews with good writeup  forthcoming from others ....  absolutely a must try  Ajax just keeps getting better and better  food - wise  .  The food is in those buffet style hotplate  that keep food  warm ; so is not  scalding hot by any means  -  but still tasty none the less.  Most customers were take - out   there is a seating area with a few people sitting down having food .  There are frozen paratha  and frozen food items in the freezer section  that they have made .  Big plus having so many ethnic places in Ajax that have good food  decent portions  good prices and excellent quality of ingredients.  Dina noticed reviewers for their other location saying parking is sparse at their other location  -  note :  their Ajax location has plenty of parking btw.
reviews.name: Dina

reviews.text: The food was amazing  large selection to temp every taste bud. Beth had the veggie samosas  spicy chicken and chicken birani which were all wonderful. Will definitely be back to tey some more !
reviews.name: Beth

reviews.text: Canbe Foods recently opened their new location in Ajax.  They have Indian and Sri Lankan food prepared and made to order.  Josephine visited here today and were impressed with the cleanliness and the seating area for eating  which was lacking at their older location in Scarborough .  See the photos  it is bright and clean.  Josephine had chicken samosa  kothu roti  coconut roti  rice noodle.  They were delicious and just as consistent as their other location.  Parking was plentiful and service was quick.
reviews.name: Josephine

reviews.text: amazing food !  love the yellow thin noodles and the mutton rolls
reviews.name: Sarah

reviews.text: The Sri Lankan food here is delicious !  ! The added bonus is that they have a lot of snacks  frozen food options that you can pick up for later. The restaurant is very clean with excellent restrooms and attentive staff.
reviews.name: Dalikes

reviews.text: Ryan have gone to this location several times.  Upon each visit the ladies working there are friendly and welcoming.  Ryan went with a friend who has not  had Indian food before and they suggested some good options after asking some questions about his spice tolerance.  They provide huge portions and unlike some other Indian food joints  the cooking oil in the food is at a minimum.  Great prices  huge portions  tasty food  and friendly service combine to make an amazing place.  For      which includes a drink   you will  be full all day after having rice and two curries !   :
reviews.name: Ryan

reviews.text: If you are  in the mood for delicious SAMOSAS !  this is the spot.   for    veggie. Crisp with delicious  bit spicy  filling.  They also have a large selection of prepared south Indian food. The Masala Dosa is also delicious  but you need to pre order.
reviews.name: Nadeena

reviews.text: Carrie recently discovered this place and are so happy Carrie did !  Such friendly people !  The samosas are      !  !  And they are  so good  not too greasy which is awesome. Carrie recently tried one of their combo meals and it was great. You get so much food for    -   !   Looking forward to trying more !
reviews.name: Carrie

reviews.text: Love the food here !  There samosas are by far the best !  There is usually a line up on weekends but it goes pretty fast and definitely worth the wait
reviews.name: Michele

reviews.text: Food is good for Ajax Sri Lankan eats. Rolls and biriyani are the best. Also sell a huge variety of frozen foods for out of towners.
reviews.name: Dil

reviews.text: Better location then the Scarborough location  much cleaner...but for some reason the food tastes better at the Scarborough location. The Ajax location has a  nice place to sit if you want to stay and eat. If the go at their peak periods be prepared to wait a bit in the line. Prices and the amount of food per order can not  be beat !
reviews.name: Liza

reviews.text: They do not have authentic Indian style dosa . They cater more to the Sri Lankan customers. The idllis are also not fresh  most of the times they are very hard and stale. The sambhar for the dosa is very thick which is not how it is supposed to be.
reviews.name: Zubair

reviews.text: Delicious selection of Sri Lankan foods. Very friendly staff. Bonus  -  you can eat in  as there is a seating area; cafeteria style.   Noodles  rice dishes  rolls  samosas  rotis  -  and so much more. Love their stronghoppers and pol sambol  As a Sri Lankan M can attest this place is the real deal !
reviews.name: M

reviews.text: Staff is taught how to lie instinctively at both the Ajax and Scarborough Locations. Absolutely dishonest and ready to misguide you on almost any question asked !  TheOneMan asked for hot samosas one evening  they said they are not making any for the rest of the day and the cold ones on the counter are all they have. Hardly    seconds later another staff comes and empties a load of hot fresh Samosas. The lying staff member smiles shamelessly on eye - contact post fact !  Next TheOneMan asked for hot rolls; they re - fried cold ones from a few hours ago and handed me darker ones. Upon questioning the staff  they said rolls come out dark when fried and become lighter as they cool down  which is BS !   Quality of food served is seldom good and this has happened to me repeatedly at both locations. It  a disaster of a food service depending on how lucky your day could get !  TheOneMan m not eating from here again !
reviews.name: TheOneMan

reviews.text: Except Samosa nothing tastes good. Ordered biriyani and it tasted like tomato rice. Chicken was not fully cooked. The quality of food is bad. And no R do not  recommend this place
reviews.name: R

reviews.text: Joan love Indian cuisine and came across this restaurant by accident. So Joan decided to try the lunch buffet. No disappointment at all. The buffet had the usual items one normally sees at Indian buffets but this buffet had other  interesting foods too such as the crispy masala fried corn and a hard boiled egg in sauce. Dessert was an interesting fruit custard. Yes spicy foods.  The server brought us a bowl of raita   yogurt sauce   which he said to taste if food was to spicy for us as raita would tame the heat. The place was clean and neat  prices moderate. Our buffet about     each for lunch buffet. One can also order off menu. The buffet came with a bottle if water per person. Joan would certainly return after our enjoyable experience. Restaurant caters. Open   days a week for lunch and dinner. There is something four vegetarians too; plus menu features South Indian and Indo - Chinese items. Overall the menu  has plenty of choices to choose from
reviews.name: Joan

reviews.text: Fancy  No.  Tasty  Very !   Surprisingly good Indian buffet with a good assortment of Vegetarian options.... the Cauliflower Gobi and Chana Masala were the standouts for me.  No shortage of Naan and sauces.  Spice level is NOT mild but also not overwhelming. Maybe a little pricey for a lunch buffet but worth it to support the owners with a few extra bucks to pay the high Ballantyne rent.  Friendly too.
reviews.name: Betty

reviews.text: Ashley tried the lunch buffet on a Saturday. All of the food was good and flavorful. The fried cauliflower  butter chicken  and some kind of paneer were some of my favorites. Not everything on the buffet was clearly labeled  but most items were. Ashley were each given a bottle of water to drink with the buffet. This was less water than Ashley like to drink with a meal  but since the tap water in this area does not  taste good this was a nice detail. Overall  a good lunch experience. My only concern was the health rating  which Ashley spotted only after starting to eat. They had a     which Ashley feel is kind of low.
reviews.name: Ashley

reviews.text: The buffet here has a very large assortment of items compared to other Indian buffets  and their spice levels are very good. There are a lot more items on their buffet than others Randus have  had in the area  but you do pay a premium. It  still worth it.  My only complaint is the use of water bottles. Randus guess there were complaints about the water quality so this was their solution.  Randus will definitely be back.
reviews.name: Randus

reviews.text: Reena ordered take out via yelp. My order consisted of :  malai kofta  saag paneer  plain rice  naan. Order was ready on time  but the food was terrible. Its probably the worst Indian food Reena have  ever had from an Indian restaurant. The malai kofta was bland. The saag paneer was the worst !  The actual saag was so watery that it looked liked watered down chutney. Absolutely no spinach flavor. It was gross and Reena did not  eat it. The rice and naan were fine  but nothing special. They do not  have plain rice listed as an option for online orders so Reena had to call and request it. Weird. Terrible food overall.
reviews.name: Reena

reviews.text: Count me in for Tuesday Dosa Night. Fresh dosas served at your table. A buffet of some simple staples while waiting for your hot dosas to arrive. You could choose your basic potato filling or meat and veggies  You are  bound to find something appealing. A couple of items even had some heat. Service was pleasant but you felt like you were on your own most of the time.  Finish your meal off with delicious chai  winner winner dosa dinner.
reviews.name: Tonya

reviews.text: Jacqueline came here on Tuesday for Dosa Buffet night. Jacqueline had heard good things about it and everyone was right !   The dosas are made to order and they were quite good. Jacqueline all seemed to like the butter masala ones the most  but they were all very good. They were light and easy to share.   The buffet is filled with a variety of delicious Indian food. Jacqueline love Indian food  but Jacqueline m not very familiar with a lot of the cuisine so the buffet was a great way to try new things. Jacqueline did not  know what most of it was  but everything Jacqueline had was delicious. Jacqueline especially liked the chana masala.   The best part is  you get all of this for     !  It  a great deal for the amount an quality of the food.   If you like Indian food  Jacqueline would definitely recommend checking this place out !
reviews.name: Jacqueline

reviews.text: Went for a buffet lunch and it was excellent just like everybody else said. Jennifer have  been eating Indian food for about    years and this was as good as it gets. Jennifer was impressed with the shrimp curry dish being on a buffet.  As an aside  their ventilation is much better than the previous restaurant. It was not steamy  nor did Jennifer come out smelling like food. Fantastic.
reviews.name: Jennifer

reviews.text: TLDR :  The food is flavorful  endless  and ready - to - eat. The vibe is casual. The servers are friendly and fast. When you are in the mood for an Indian food coma - consider Red Chillez.
reviews.name: Anthony

reviews.text: Delicious food and great service with a friendly personable touch !  Had some dishes in the buffet that Andrew have  never had before and was pleasantly surprised !  If Andrew are  back in the area Andrew would  love to come again.
reviews.name: Andrew

reviews.text: The buffet here has a very large assortment of items compared to other Indian buffets  and their spice levels are very good. Each item Randus had off the buffet was delicious  even my wife who does not  like Palak Paneer went up for seconds after trying mine. There are a lot more items on their buffet than others Randus have  had in the area  but you do pay a premium. It  still worth it.  My only complaint is the unnecessary use of water bottles. Randus think the first one is free but you have to buy more  which is not  good for a place that makes spicy food. Randus may be wrong here but Randus did not  bother to ask since Randus was not  going to add another water bottle to the landfill. Replace that and Randus would  give a higher review.
reviews.name: Randus

reviews.text: Good food  amazing service  poor ventilation in the restaurant so your clothes will need a direct washing when you get home from the restaurant !
reviews.name: Stephen

reviews.text: went for the lunch buffet on tuesday. arrived at      and the open sign wasnt on but tried the door and it was open. no one greeted me so Scott chose a booth and went to the buffet line. there were only maybe   spots filled. finally at noon the buffet was filled and Scott got a bit. most of the dishes looked like they were rewarmed from the weekend. the tandoor chicken was pink on the inside and rubbery. THE FOOD WAS TERRIBLE. will not go back. very unhappy with the food and a remarkable lack of service.
reviews.name: Scott

reviews.text: ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS lunch buffet   their selection is big !  Hirie loved my meal just as much as the atmosphere. Great Punjab music videos playing and extremely nice customer service. Well deserved   star rating !  !  !  !
reviews.name: Hirie

reviews.text: The Mysore masala dosa was great  but the sambar really stole the show for me. Carol was not  as impressed with the Chana batura  though. Mainly because the batura was too thick.
reviews.name: Carol

reviews.text: Delicious buffet with amazing flavors !  Things for vegans  vegetarians  and celiac. The service was great and they were so friendly !
reviews.name: Jamey

reviews.text: This restaurant has recently changed names and ownership and is a lot better than it used to be  -  in the same location.  Immediately upon sitting down  the server brought bottled water for each of us. Michael am talking about the plastic bottled water that you would buy from Harris Teeter !   Michael have never seen that done before.   Anyway  the three of us ordered a bunch of different dishes and enjoyed sharing the flavors and food items. Michael think my favorite was the GOBI     which was fried cauliflower. It was magnificently prepared with the best spices. The Gobi was preceded by paneer  which is an Indian cheese  cut into square pieces and served with onions and peppers. Michael also ordered one of the curry dishes and a Ravaa Dosa  which was served with chutney and lentil soup.  The dosa was served flat on the plate  as opposed to the rolled up dosas that Michael have had in the past.  Finally  Michael shared some cheese bread.  Michael can not  say enough greats things about the quality of the food and the flavors.   There were two things that Michael thought could have been better.  The dishes could have been served a little warmer than what they were.  The second thing is that the service was painfully slow.  It took at least    minutes for our first dish to be served.  And it stayed slow  all the way til the end of our meal. Perhaps they are undergoing start up pains or perhaps they were understaffed tonight.  No sure.  What Michael will remember is the how my palette jumped up and down with each bite.   There is a bar in the restaurant  but the emphasis seems to be on beer and wine. The atmosphere is light and quiet  which worked perfectly for us.   If they speed up the service and warm up the food just a tad  this place will be a winner in the Ballantyne area !   Regardless  Michael thought it was four star experience.
reviews.name: Michael

reviews.text: It  Indigenous peoples  day today and Chris were going to o have sushi...but Mr Tokyo was packed...so Chris were going to Sky Asian...not open...so Chris were then going to our normal Indian Buffet and my wife said  Oh  that place opened in ballantyne  and Chris called to see if they had lunch.  The person answering the phone was nice and said they were open and buffet was ready  etc...  AND OH MY GOODNESS !  !  !  !  !   Best Indian Buffet Chris have ever had.  the place was absolutely packed and Chris do not  think they expected the crowd  but they sat us within minutes and ...Chris can not  say enough good stuff.  The food was OUTSTANDING.  Chris tried about    different dishes  special thanks to the Chicken      the Best chicken masala and curry Chris have  had in years  and the eggplant potato dish was just off the charts...  Everything had enough spice to make you crave more and not too much to make you cry...just enough for a nice head sweat if you eat too fast  you know what Chris mean   and when were were STUFFED  my wife decided on dessert...and she picked the mango and what looked like little flapjacks with a sugary pudding...And it turns out the sugary stuff was the best dessert Chris have  tasted since lava cakes came into existence.  It was a form of bread pudding that Chris cannot describe other than  PLEASE HAVE MORE  Chris wish Chris could remember the name but it was purely amazing.    All in all  EXCELLENT staff  great service  food was hot and spicy and just out of this world.  It is  by far  the best Indian Chris have  had in Charlotte.   By Far.  Chris would  give it    stars if Chris could.
reviews.name: Chris

reviews.text: Dosa night for the win !  Every Tuesday night they have made to order dosas. Our group ordered several of them and Daniel got to try the following  -  potato  egg bhurji  butter chicken   lamb. They were all good  however  the butter chicken and egg dosas were my favorite. While waiting for the dosas to arrive hit up the buffet. Nice dining experience !
reviews.name: Daniel

reviews.text: This used to be Persis Biryani Indian Grill. Lauren love their chicken tikka masala and eating here for buffet !
reviews.name: Lauren

reviews.text: Jess kept on saying  Jess think they would make a killing offering Dosas AND Mimosas ;    Jess do not  think Jess would have found out about Red Chillez if it were not  for a dinner group that Jess joined  but Jess m so glad that Jess did  and also glad that Jess came on a Tuesday for their Dosa Buffet. To be      honest with you  Jess did not  know what a Dosa is  -  it is  essentially a folded crepe.  Red Chillez offers a traditional buffet with some non - standard items. Jess really enjoyed trying all of the dips and spreads and figuring out what Jess loved and what Jess still have not  acquired a taste for. In addition to the buffet  there are Dosa menus on the tables for you to basically order bottomless  made - to - order Dosas. And they are  ALL delicious.   Unfortunately Jess can not  speak for any of the other menu items or days of the week  but with the quality of the food that Jess experienced in the buffet  Jess think it is  probably safe to say that you would not  be let down.  BUT  on Tuesdays  all of this endless food can be yours for a LOW price of    . Jess  definitely  got my money  worth  and if it were closer this would be a staple destination. But Jess think it is  great for anybody to check out once.
reviews.name: Jess

reviews.text: Above - average Indian restaurant in Charlotte that might be best visited on their Tuesday Dosa Nights  which also includes their dinner buffet with dishes like Biryani  Uthappam  Chole Batura  Idli and Sambar .  DOSA MENU  Veg Dosas :  Masala Dosa Guntur Masala Dosa Mysore Masala Dosa Ghee Dosa Plain Dosa Spring Noodles Dosa  Non - Veg Dosas :  Omelet Dosa Kodi Vepudu Dosa Lamb Sukka Dosa  Kids Dosas :  Jam Dosa Chocolate Dosa Cheese Dosa
reviews.name: Ajay

reviews.text: Move over Taco Tuesdays  Dosa night at Red Chillez is the place to be.   Nikki went here for our first ever Yelp  International Supper Club gathering. This was my first time experiencing Red Chillez. Every Tuesday is dosa night. What does this mean  You can get made to order dosas along with the buffet. The dosa menu has six vegetarian options  three non - veg  and three kid - friendly options. Nikki had a group of about    people  so Nikki ordered several to share. My hands - down favorite was the butter chicken dosa. The buffet had your basic Indian staples  plus a hot chai tea. A bottle of water  the buffet  and made to order dosas  =  about    . Great price.   Other notes :  you can place orders online. You can also choose your level of spiciness for each dish. They also offer breakfast Friday - Sunday from   -   am. For the lunch crowd  they have a promo where you can get a free lunch buffet when you purchase nine buffets.  Highly recommend checking this place out on a Tuesday. Nikki would definitely come back for dosa night.
reviews.name: Nikki

photos.caption: Good fillings. Not enough curry though.
photos.label: food

reviews.text: Visited this place with my Office colleagues  Abhishek had Dalpuri with Aloo Chana and Tomatoes Choka  Fried Fish sandwich  Doubles  Wraps.. the food was overall was tasty with huge portions. The Dine in experience is also good as the place has spacious sitting area and is very neat. Abhishek would recommended this place if you are looking around for some good West Indian food for a small group    -   people  of family or friends.
reviews.name: Abhishek

reviews.text: Best doubles Serena ever had outside of Trinidad. Everything from the consistency of the barra and the mango tasted authentic. Serena would have thought Serena was in trini If it was not  for the snow outside. They have all the trini sodas and snacks. Amy was very polite and service was fast. Serena will definitely return
reviews.name: Serena

reviews.text: This roti shop is high quality  the staff are friendly and the food tastes amazing. The prices are average  but they have a wide variety of foods. They cook vegetarian food separately to ensure that it is not contaminated by any meats. This is the new Lena  Roti   Doubles  there is an older one which Kiran Shane do not recommend as the food there is very poor quality. Any long time Lena  fan should be aware of this change. Lena  is our go - to restaurant for West Indian food. Kiran Shane would recommend  and will come again to Lena  Roti   Doubles.  BTW :  To tell apart the two shops  the good one has large green text on the building itself while the bad one has green text on a black background .
reviews.name: Kiran Shane

reviews.text: This is my favorite spot for doubles in the GTA. The doubles are fresh  tasty and taste so authentic you will think you are back in Trinidad.
reviews.name: Nav

reviews.text: Very impressive. Best West Indian food Valishti Artee have  had in North America. They definitely got their roti right !  Taking off one star only because the fried aloo was not on par with the other dishes.
reviews.name: Valishti Artee

reviews.text: The food was fast and delicious. Tony had the boneless goat and it was hot and sizzling. Lots of parking spaces and lunchtime is not  too busy. The ordering steps are easy and there are nice people there.
reviews.name: Tony

reviews.text: The food was not  horrible but Nadia was not  impressed either  Nadia visited on a Friday around lunch time the dining room was full and there was a little bit of a line but the cashier was quick so Nadia did not  wait long to place my order  It took less than   minutes for my doubles to come out after Nadia ordered them for me Nadia like my doubles a little bit on the runny side and the Curry was not  that runny Nadia did not  like the dough it lacked flavor to me overall if someone were to give it to me Nadia would  eat it but Nadia do not  think Nadia would go back and spend my own money on it
reviews.name: Nadia

reviews.text: Now this is good food. This was a skip the dishes order and the food was delivered hot. Tamsyn ordered the basic staples such as doubles  Aloo pie  pholourie and a boneless goat roti. Tamsyn also ordered two solo drinks  currants roll and Kurma to try. The pictures speak for themselves when showing you quality food. There  no filler... like a ridiculous amount of potato for the curry goat  what you get is honest and delicious food. They did not  forget a single item from our order  they sent us napkins and cutlery. This location is definitely raising the bar for quality food delivered right to your door from skip the dishes. Do not hesitate to try their boneless goat roti because the flavors were outstanding. This is my go - to when Tamsyn m craving home cooked  flavorful food from the islands. My boyfriend enjoyed every single dish and complimented the amount of goat Tamsyn received in the Roti as he  had other experiences and they were never this good. Tamsyn had no problem ordering from their menu options on the app  because they put no pepper as an option... Other restaurants of this nature should follow suit. Tamsyn will certainly be a repeat customer.
reviews.name: Tamsyn

reviews.text: Nice authentic West Indian restaurant. Good food and prices are not  too bad. Good variety of food also.
reviews.name: Tariq

reviews.text: Unfortunately quality West Indian food is not part of the standard here. Service is also terrible. Food is over priced for the quantity and quality. Apart from that it is decent in esthetics.  This place would not be at the top of my recommendation list.
reviews.name: Candice

reviews.text: Some of the best roti Chris have had in the city. The goat curry roti is especially recommended !  Incredibly fresh and so tasty !
reviews.name: Chris

reviews.text: The doubles here are so great.  My boyfriend had the goat roti in paratha and he really enjoyed it as well. Harpreet would definitely recommend this place for your roti and doubles cravings !
reviews.name: Harpreet

reviews.text: Chrissy swear  the Caribbean girl in me cries out when Chrissy eat doubles... Chrissy love everything about doubles  the doughy texture  the spicy chickpeas inside  that spicy sauce that you pour all over it... it is  so satisfying and one is never enough.   During one of the many event for a Hindu wedding  Chrissy order    doubles to munch on  since theses events have to be vegetarian meals  and doubles were such a crowd pleaser. Everyone loved how flavorful they were. Package nicely and the sauces that came with them were oh so delicious. These folks were super fast and these doubles were prepared well.  Try them out if you are in the neighborhood... you wo not  regret it
reviews.name: Chrissy

reviews.text: This gets   stars simply because the food was on point. Flavourful  fresh  delicious  good value and quick service.  a few of us in the office were looking for a place for lunch. one of the west Indian guys with us said how about Roti and doubles and Aaron all said sure. Found this place on Yelp and it had good reviews so why not   this place easy to find its in the home depot plaza northeast corner of airport and queen. tiny place  enough tables to sit down and scarf what you ordered but in my opinion this is a take out place.  That  not a bad thing  the flavours my God are great !  it is  taking the best of Indian cooking and west Indian spices and fusing it into a delicious take out lunch. colleague got the chicken doubles  great price   boss got the   .   chicken roti special  and Aaron got the lamb. so much flavour  spicy  savoury  tender meat  very satisfying and made me really happy.  If Aaron m in the area again Aaron m coming back and Aaron m buying extra to bring home. which by the way  you wo not  spend a lot on.     -     a person is more than enough to fill you up.  Solid  .  out of  .  bumped to   because of the great food and super fast service.
reviews.name: Aaron

reviews.text: Been to Lena  roti when they were in Etobicoke at that time their food was delicious. This is the first time Sandra tried them after their move. Sandra visited the Brampton location. The girl behind the counter was good however the doubles were not good  the baras were not cooked properly and was sticking to the butter paper  it was not easy to bite into them as they were so chewy. The chutney was sweet absolutely no spice  Sandra was not asked if Sandra wanted any pepper sauce. The Roti was still good. The premises was clean  Sandra was disappointed as Sandra was craving their doubles.
reviews.name: Sandra

reviews.text: Thumbs up !   Atif was in a hurry and stumbled across this place.  Walking in  Atif saw their vegetarian options  and lacking veggies in a few days  Atif figured why not get some green in me.   Ate a wrapped roti with Okra  spinich and curried Potatoes in it.  Feel great !   Lots of daily chicken roti  goat roti specials. Atif will be back !  !  !  !  !  !
reviews.name: Atif

reviews.text: Decided to check this place out after all the good reviews Ve have  seen on Yelp. Unfortunately Ve can not  say the same !   Ordered the goat dhalpourie roti and the goat was so tender but they only gave me   pieces. It was mostly filled with potatoes and bones with no meat on it. Ve like my roti saucier but it dried up halfway. It could have  been good  but it fell flat.  One thing that really stood out to me was the treatment of the workers here... it seems like the worker here is afraid of Lena and Ve even heard Lena yelling at the lady working at the back
reviews.name: Ve

reviews.text: Shelley was out shopping for an outfit for my wedding. After a long morning Shelley needed something delicious. Shelley ended up stopping in for a quick bite at Lena  Roti and Shelley must say  Shelley where not disappointed. The service from Kish was nothing but a pleasure but also the food  Shelley cannot say enough about it. Shelley ended up ordering Dhal roti and channa aloo with hot sauce  hot as hell . It was so good  Shelley ended up ordering more rotis with the squash combination. The squash is actually made fresh with all ingredients from Trinidad. Shelley have had many Jamaica rotis in my time but nothing compares to Lena  Roti. It  very rare to find phenomenal service  amazing food at a reasonable price and all made fresh. Shelley have an upcoming event and will be having it all catered from Kish himself. Solid restaurant and Shelley hope to see another location in Burlington  :
reviews.name: Shelley

reviews.text: Authentic delicious trini food  one of the best in Toronto. Love their doubles  goat in dhalpuri  and veggie platter with the jackfruit  mango  callaloo  chick peas  and okra with bus up shut to dip. They even give you a small container or chutney which Leela  does not  even provide !  They also have tamarind and hot sauce too. All of it was delicious plus their cassava or pone was so fresh
reviews.name: Kimi

reviews.text: Nino think this place is terribly over priced and the portions are very small.  Nino definitely would try one of the many other west indian restaurants in Brampt
reviews.name: Nino

reviews.text: So spicy and flavorful !  Shrimp Pakoras really good and not too oily. Chicken tangra really tasty too  if you like chicken tikka masala you will  love this !  . Appreciated the fact that the manchurian seafood rice actually tasted like seafood  instead of a oil - flavorless - spicy taste  and did not have too much food coloring.
reviews.name: Joyce

reviews.text: This is a good take - out place for hakka food in the north end of Markham.  They have a wide selections of dishes to choose from and offer     off with cash payment. They always have food ready for you at the time requested  unlike Fredericks; unreliable with pick up . Chili chicken is not as good as Fredericks but this location is much more convenient for me.  My favourite dishes here are :  Tangra villa chicken  crispy ginger beef.  Katelyn will come back and try other dishes next time. They also offer party trays at reasonable prices.
reviews.name: Katelyn

reviews.text: Th service is really good and the owners are awesome. Very friendly and seems like a family run establishment.   Reem thought the food was mediocre though not as good as federicks in Markham but maybe Reem ordered the wrong thing.   Will give it another try. Not bad if you are  in the area for lunch looking for cheap eats. The     lunch special is well worth the money.
reviews.name: Reem

reviews.text: The only delicious food item at this take out is tangra villa chicken. Noodles is good enough. R do not  like any of their fried rice items. R go here only because it is  close by. Service is fast but R have no idea why they expect you to pay tip when they pass you the billing machine for a take out !
reviews.name: R

reviews.text: This is a pretty good place to get Hakka food !  It  not a dine in place however !  It  only take out or catering. The prices are really good too and very cheap for the amount you get !  Lots of vegetarian options and spring rolls are yummy !    The lunch specials are limited to a few options of their choice but they come with your choice of meal AND spring roll OR pop can OR water bottle. It  only    unless u go for the premium options like fried rice or noodles.   The waiting space is super small  so order in before you go so you can just pay and leave !  The service is excellent !
reviews.name: Mathanega

reviews.text: Most of the complaints about this place seem to be about the lunch rush specials which Trevor have  never encountered as Trevor m usually there to pick up dinner in the evening and for me it is  perfect.  Their pakora are awesome.  The tangra chicken is seasoned the same way as the pakora and equally delicious.  Their chilli chicken is not  anything to write home about though.  The crispy beef is a better and tasty substitute.  People at the counter have always been nothing but kind and courteous to me and other members of my family that frequent this for pretty regular weekend takeout.
reviews.name: Trevor

reviews.text: Quick and tasty take out option. Generous lunch portion for a reasonable price. Jamie tried the Chili Chicken and Crispy Ginger Beef. Both were quite delicious but the beef was a little chewy. Would order from here again.
reviews.name: Jamie

reviews.text: Tammy ordered ahead of time for lunch as Tammy was told that it usually gets busy. The lady on the phone was farily polite and noted that it would be a    minute wait for   orders. For that long of a wait  Tammy expected the food to taste a lot more fresh !  !  The general tao chicken was way too soggy and bland. As well as the rice being extremely hard. A friend of mine got the Singaporean noodles and all Tammy could taste was curry powder. Tastes just like fast food  but not fast !    Overall  wo not  be coming back.
reviews.name: Tammy

reviews.text: Okay Hakka cuisine. Anthony have  had a lot better. For the prices they charge the food should be a lot better  but it is  not.   Anthony only come here once in a while if Anthony m in the mood for Hakka and dont feel like driving south to get real authentic Hakka chilli chicken.   Anthony guess you could say this is my second yet first option just because it is  so close to my house.
reviews.name: Anthony

reviews.text: Monica FINALLY decided to try this place out after years of seeing tangra featured of the snap stories of my friends.  Tangra is a go - to restaurant for flavourful  spicy  comfort foods. They primarily focus on chicken  beef  fish  and shrimp but also offer a variety of noodle  rice  and vegetarian dishes. Most of the dishes are wet and saucy ie. their chili dishes  mango dishes  sweet and spicy  sweet and sour dishes are heavily marinated with sauces and stir - fried onions. If you are looking for something dry however  Monica highly recommend the Tangra - Villa Meat dishes.   To say Tangra is flavourful is an understatement. With every bite Monica can taste the garlic  the spices  the onions  and the parsley used in the seasoning. This is definitely an upgrade from the typical garlic and soy sauce dressing in other local Chinese restaurants.  The lady manning the phone was polite  the portion sizes were fair  and the overall takeout experience was pretty great. For around     tax included  my family of four was stuffed with enough leftovers for lunch the next day. Good deal.  However  do call ahead of time because it takes them    -    minutes usually to cook   -   take - out dishes  and you will have to wait in the car since the store itself is quite compact.
reviews.name: Monica

reviews.text: Small takeout place in a plaza. Food portion is good. Great food  tastes good. Jun love the hot   sour soup but not the Tom Yum soup.   Highly recommended
reviews.name: Jun

reviews.text: Tangra Villa is outstanding. The place is a bit hidden in the plaza but foods awesome and delicious. Would definitely be back for more. Price is right and quantity is good.
reviews.name: San Jay

reviews.text: The tastiest Hakka Chinese food Melwyn have  tasted in Canada. And their quality and quantity has been consistent for many years now. Only take out. Busy place but very efficiently run by some very pleasant people. Try their crispy ginger beef and Tangra villa specials. Food is always fresh and with generous portions of meat or seafood. Veggies are always done just right. Worth a try and definitely worth going back for more.
reviews.name: Melwyn

reviews.text: The food was decent average  Am ordered Schezwan Chicken and House Special Manchurian Fried Rice. Am was surprised to see corn in the fried rice  it seems like they use the frozen food that one typically gets from the grocery stores.  Am will not go back again because Am am sure there are places better than this out there.
reviews.name: Am

reviews.text: This is my favourite restaurant for a quick and bang for our buck takeout !   Normally  Betty like to order the hot and sour soup  chicken pakora  fried rice  chicken and beef dish.  For two people  this is enough for dinner and plenty for the next day. If you are  not use to spicy  you can ask for milder spice.  Whenever Betty do not  feel like cooking  Betty think about this restaurant. It  affordable and the staff here are always nice.
reviews.name: Betty

reviews.text: Very disappointed. Viola love Hakka food and especially chili chicken. This just did not  cut it. Viola ordered chili chicken with veggie chow mein and fried rice. The chili chicken is full of fat and does not  taste like the authentic Hakka style chili chicken. The chow mein tasted like a greasy hot mess. Never again. The portions are big but the quality just is not  there. Nobody in the house enjoyed this food and Viola all like Hakka style.
reviews.name: Viola

reviews.text: Went only once after calling in the order. Chatted with the person there about the lack of  Hakka options in the Unionville area. Got home to find out they burnt the food leaving a strong scent. Either cook had a cold or did not  care and just switched pot to finish the dish after burning the first.
reviews.name: Karan

reviews.text: The food was good  and huge portions.  Recommend the chili paneer schezwen style.  It comes with rice.  Matt did not  like the hot sour soup.  Food here could feed an army  Comfort food  not sure about hakka.
reviews.name: Matt

reviews.text: good food and good service !  Only take - out available  call ahead first for quick pick up.  And it is  hidden in a small plaza right on McCowan road and Manhattan road.
reviews.name: Steven

reviews.text: good for the lunch price but that is  pretty much it. this is a place for high school students to eat who do not  know what real hakka food is and just need a big portion of something cheap to fill up on. it is  filled with kids at lunch and there is  no place to eat. on other days theres this fat white girl that is the RUDEST person Meow have ever dealt with. heard of her before because she was rude to my friends father just because he could not  hear what she was muttering but experienced her for myself and wanted to punch her across the face. the weirdest part was that with the lunch combo you get a free canned drink but when Meow asked for nestea they said it is  an extra    cents.    cents is nothing but Meow just did not  understand why a canned nestea was an extra    cents. this place is weird and the food is mostly oil
reviews.name: Meow

reviews.text: Good local take out place run by nice family.   Call ahead and pick up in    minutes is a good plus.   Have not  had any issues and gives competition to the many Asian places in Markham.
reviews.name: Chris

reviews.text: Fast convenient tasty food.  It  a quick pick up window. The foods tasty and the people are friendly. Better then going and being just a number at the big spots is to come here and feel welcome and treated so well.  Close to home so easy spot. Definite regular repeat for us
reviews.name: Mohmoney2000

reviews.text: Just tried the Manchurian Chicken and the Hakka Noodles lunch special at Tangra Villa and Pauline have to say both were very tasty and great value for your money.  Lunch specials include a pop for   .   !   You can not  beat that.  Pauline will  be back to try other items on the menu !
reviews.name: Pauline

reviews.text: No dine in -  this whole in the wall hakka place is always packed and full of students. However they must be using a completely different spice pallate then all the other hakka places in the area.  Really Good -  Shaheed recommend it !
reviews.name: Shaheed

reviews.text: Only had the chili chicken lunch special.  Good flavour and sauce.     for it  comes with drink and spring roll.  For the same price you can go to Federicks and get double the chicken.
reviews.name: Jeremy

reviews.text: Hands down the best Chili chicken Anna have  had !  Anna m not usually a fan of Hakka food unlike my husband but when he brought home one of their lunch specials  Anna was amazed at how good and delicious the food was !  The owners are super friendly and nice. And the lunch specials are reasonably priced     .   -  .   with the option of a spring roll or a drink
reviews.name: Anna

reviews.text: Went here for lunch and the place was filled with students and such a small place.  NO PLACE TO EAT   WHY DON T PEOPLE MENTION THAT      NO DINING  -  ONLY TAKE OUT !  !  !   Ordered the chili chicken lunch special  -  man it should have  costed   .   !   The dish tasted very oily and NOT FLAVOUR !   JUST OIL AND CHILI S  !   !   Sorry  that is  not what Hakka is all about.  Aweful food and the owner did not  even try to make room or did NOT even try to control the kids for us adult clients who would  spend WAY more money than any student with.  Yeah  thanks lady !   Suggestion  if you like Hakka food  DON T GO HERE !  Suggest  Tangerine or Super Hakka. If you like oily tasteless food with chili  on rice  then this is the place for you !   Now Harley know why there is  only take out  -  owner  do not  care to take accountability for their food.  BEWARE !
reviews.name: Harley

reviews.text: Ali go here quite often when Ali m in markham  it is  great for take out hakka. Ali usually get the chicken pakoras  Singapore noodles  and tangra villa chicken. The chicken pakoras are fairly spicy and have a good amount of chicken per pakora. They give you quite a bit of Singapore noodles and it has a good curry flavour that is not  very overpowering. Finally the tangra villa chicken is nice and crispy and the saut ed onions are really tasty with it.  Ali sometimes also get the chili chicken or one of the beef orders  and they are really good too. They do no msg if you ask for it  and all the staff is very friendly.   Definitely one of my favourite hakka places... This and fedricks.  :
reviews.name: Ali

reviews.text: Awesome takeout place for their chicken pakoras.  Winnie was hooked the moment Winnie tried one at a friend  potluck.  Winnie usually order a party tray of it for dinner parties now.  Winnie also like their fried rice.
reviews.name: Winnie

reviews.text: Excellent food  attractively presented  and served by a polite  friendly  and attentive staff in a very pleasant room. Highly recommended !
reviews.name: Christian

reviews.text: Paul eat a lot of Indian food and find Haveli reliably friendly and tasty.  The lunch buffet today was outstanding  with excellent goat curry ... not on every menu.   Try Goa style or Madras style foods in the evening.  Inexpensive given the quality.   Pleasant wait staff.   Worth a detour.
reviews.name: Paul

reviews.text: Based on lunch buffet only. Very small buffet. Everything on my plate was lukewarm at best. There is no spice. Everything was bland or even sweet. The pork dish was the only thing with a little heat. Staff was friendly and attentive. The place was clean and nicely decorated. Amanda will not return as Amanda have  had better. Try Haldi instead.
reviews.name: Amanda

reviews.text: Henry really enjoy Indian buffets  so Henry go to a lot of them  but this one was somewhat inadequate. Granted  all the ones Henry have  been to have been on the East Coast  so this might be great for Madison Wisconsin. Henry got my usual mango lassi to accompany my meal  and it came with whipped cream and maraschino cherries and what seemed to be grenadine. Why would you do that  Not only does the mango not taste like real mango  the lassi came out way sweeter than any Henry have  had and probably sweeter than any proper lassi you would  find in India. In a similar vein  the food was OK  but it was missing the potency so signature of Indian spice  that fragrance that is  supposed to envelop you when at Indian restaurants. Where is the meaty grilledness in the tandoori chicken  Where is that earthy cumin in your samosa  Everything just tasted kind of...impotent. Henry can not  tell if it is  because they are  trying to pander to Midwestern tastes or if they are  skimping on the spices for business reasons  but Henry left the place without the taste of pungency that Henry was really hoping to load up on when Henry go to Indian buffets.  PS  -  After reading a few reviews from some Indian customers that also mentioned that they could improve their flavor  Henry feel like less of a crazy person. It seems that they are  spiced just OK for Midwestern palates but could be missing something if you are  looking for really traditional Indian food.
reviews.name: Henry

reviews.text: Haveli is hands down one of the best Indian restaurants in this area. Previously  Christina had only gotten take - out  but Christina was still super satisfied. Christina m basic and Christina get Chicken Tikka Masala every time. The chicken is very good.  Anyway  the rave review is for my  th of July trip to Haveli and actually sit there to have a meal.  The servers were the nicest people in the world. They were so kind and patient and made jokes  which Christina love. There were four of us  and only one of my friends ordered a mango lassi. Another server who did not take our order came to our table confused on who got it  so then he joked that Christina would just all take sips and pass it around. Maybe you had to be there  but Christina thought it was pretty funny.  It  deceptively a lot of full. Christina was super full afterwards.   There  a discount if you pay in cash !
reviews.name: Christina

reviews.text: This place is very solid but William feel like the meat they use is not that great. My suggestion to others would have to be try the Vege Biryani  unless you like gritty meat and bones ...
reviews.name: William

reviews.text: Executive summary :   great food  especially for vegetarians and gluten - sensitive folks.  Good service.  Clean restrooms.  Ample parking.     Melissa think my favorite dish is the shahi paneer.  No  the vegetable korma.  No  wait  bhindi masala...argh  Melissa can not  pick just one !   Lots of vegetarian options here  which Melissa love !   Even some vegan options labeled as such on the menu.  They also have tons of chicken  lamb  seafood and beef dishes and a few pork options.  And of course naan and mango lassi.  Service is good.  Melissa have  always had attentive servers.  My water glass is rarely empty  food arrives promptly.  They can be a little slow bringing the check though.  Melissa think maybe they are  giving me time to finish my meal but oh  no  Melissa want a to go box so Melissa can enjoy this food again tomorrow !   The bowls of curry seem small when they first set them on the table but Melissa do not  think Melissa have  ever finished a full one in one sitting.  Especially not if Melissa have an order of naan for the table.  The restroom is a single seater located in the entry vestibule.  It  always been clean and well stocked when Melissa have  been there.  There  lots of parking available outside the restaurant and in the surrounding strip mall.  This is definitely one of my top three favorite Indian places in Madison.  Whether it is  number       or   mostly depends on which one Melissa have  been to last.
reviews.name: Melissa

reviews.text: Went by and the buffet was happening so Scott said to myself   self  lets do it . So that is  what Scott did.  The food was good with a nice variety of dishes. Scott especially enjoyed the spicy goat curry and rice with peas.  Thank you for the meal. Scott give you my blessing. May your business prosper !
reviews.name: Scott

reviews.text: The food here is delicious !   Courtney ordered the coconut naan as an appetizer and it came to the table piping hot. It was so good that Courtney had difficulty not eating it all and filling up before our entrees arrived. For my entree Courtney ordered the Lamb Masala  which arrived promptly. The portion of curry looked like it was going to be small but Courtney actually had to take most of it home as it was deceivingly large.  Entrees were delicious.  The staff is very attentive and polite.  Most people can expect to spend about     a person for dinner.  Courtney just moved to the neighborhood and this will be one of my regular dinner spots !
reviews.name: Courtney

reviews.text: Unexpectedly wonderful Indian cuisine  Tony had the Tandoori Mixed Grill. Huge portion with a mix of plump juicy shrimp  amazingly tender chicken and delicious fish  tons of vegetables and great flavors !  They served rice with Tikka Masala and another garlic sauce  just tremendous. Tony ordered hot and it was not too spicy  next time Tony might order the next level hotter  but it was excellent in any case. Very attentive service  too !
reviews.name: Tony

reviews.text: Came here for lunch with some co - workers. Did not  know anything about this place because a friend suggested it. Lambeau love Indian food  Lambeau will  put that out there right now. This place is great. During lunch they have the buffet for    . If you pay cash they take     off. So basically you pay    if you have cash.   Lambeau was surprised that they had as many options that they did. Lambeau was also surprised that the food was as fresh as it was. Lambeau m not a fan of buffets. Lambeau would  rather go to a restaurant and eat because the food is more fresh. Was not disappointed at all. They have all the favorites. Samosas  naan  chicken tikka masala etc. They also have vegetarian and vegan curries as well. All dishes were delicious and flavorful. The Naan and samosas were soft and warm. Lambeau thought they would be dry from the heat but they were perfect. Lambeau put down   full plates of food and had enough room for mango ice cream.   Service was good and the restaurant was clean. If Lambeau lived closer to this place Lambeau would go here more often and would try their dinner menu. Based on the lunch buffet Lambeau assume that their dinners are great as well.
reviews.name: Lambeau

reviews.text: Discounts for paying with cash  friendly attentive staff. Good Indian food  try the veggie Vindaloo or chicken tikka masala or the Aloo Gobi. Have not  made it to the lunch buffet but that is  weekdays for   .  .
reviews.name: C

reviews.text: Edward stopped in here for lunch because Edward heard it had a good buffet.  Edward m not a connoisseur of Indian food  so Edward really was not  sure what to find. There were lots of new flavors Edward had not  experienced  but Edward was feeling brave and gave it a shot. Overall the buffet selection was more than adequate  but for my personal taste it was a little lacking in  non  curry spicy options.    To the individual who has an experienced pallet and taste for Indian food Edward bet this would be absolutely awesome !
reviews.name: Edward

reviews.text: It  been awhile since Michael have  been  but the food was just all right. CTM was OK but nothing to write home about. Cheese naan was a joke. It was a yellow cheese and tasted as though they had simply made a grilled cheese but with naan instead of loaf bread.
reviews.name: Michael

reviews.text: Both the lunch buffet and the dinner menu are fantastic  both in quality and range of options. The price is reasonable too. My favorite Indian place in Madison !
reviews.name: Kenneth

reviews.text: Kimberly went for the lunch buffet. Kimberly am thrilled to have Indian cuisine close to work  and a reasonably priced buffet.  Since Kimberly paid in cash  it was     for   people for buffet with water as drinks.   Kimberly thought the chicken Tikka masala was OK. Everything else was wonderful. Kimberly am looking forward to coming here again with my family for dinner.  The food quality is good  prove is reasonable  and the location and building is very nice. The staff was friendly and helpful !  No wait for a quick business lunch.  If you are  riding on the bike path  this is a great lunch stop for the price.  All you can eat and mango Kimberly have  cream for dessert !
reviews.name: Kimberly

reviews.text: Joel came here hoping to find some good Indian food close to where Joel live  and this is definitely our new go to place when Joel are  in the mood for naan and curry. The service was a bit slow  but worth the wait. Joel ordered Chicken Tikka Masala  Garlic Naan  and Curry with Chicken. The waiter was very kind and when he thought the food was too spicy for my partner  when it was just too hot temperature wise  he brought him a free glass of lemonade to help wash it down. It was a bit expensive but Joel will definitely be eating there again.
reviews.name: Joel

reviews.text: One of our favorites. Katie tried Haveli a little over a year ago and immediately fell in love. The food is delicious and plentiful  my favorite chicken tikka masala in Madison . The staff is attentive -  -  my boyfriend orders his meals there the hottest they will  go and they always remember us as soon as Katie walk in. Katie suggest Haveli to everyone Katie know.
reviews.name: Katie

reviews.text: Aditi do not  know how this place has got such a high rating.. Aditi have tried almost every indian place in madison and this one surely is in the bottom.. Tried buffet and it was just pathetic  minimum options and so so food.. There are better places like amber and swagat.. This is Over rated !  ! Also not to forget Aditi all ended up with upset stomachs so there is the cherry on top !  !
reviews.name: Aditi

reviews.text: Dal tadka is really great. Also tried their paneer Tikka masala which was also good. Quick and prompt service  decent ambience. They have a wine and beer list too. The big bonus to most Indian  looking to eat home cooked food is the chapati which was fresh and nicely done.
reviews.name: Aditi

reviews.text: Great overall experience !  The combination of ambiance  food and exceptional service made this from our first experience  a place jim will return !
reviews.name: jim

reviews.text: This place was wonderful.  Brooke had heard good things about it and they were not wrong.  First the service was wonderful.  The waiter was helpful and friendly.  When Brooke asked for a recommendation on the veggie portion of the menu he did not steer me wrong !   It was SO good      and he was nice enough to keep checking on my spicy level preference.  Well done Haveli.
reviews.name: Brooke

reviews.text: Demi went here to try the lunch buffet last Saturday and was impressed.Demi have been a regular at Maharaja for years  but Demi might now be an even bigger fan of this Indian restaurant. The lunch buffet has a lot of great offerings.Though the space around the buffet is crowded and could be opened up more  the buffet items were delicious. Demi had an amazing eggplant dish  the Tikki masala was so good  even better than Maharajas  and they give you a choice of regular Nan or coconut Nan. The coconut nan is out of this world !  Their tandoori chicken was nice and tender and not too dry  also an excellent dish. Demi also tried their rice pudding and Mango Lassi which were both excellent. Demi think being a newer restaurant there are a couple of kinks to be ironed out like making sure the buffet has enough plates and bowls available.The staff was friendly which Demi appreciated. Maharaja upped their buffet prices on the weekend which Demi think was not their best move and not only is this place more affordable but Demi think has better food overall.Demi will be back  :  -
reviews.name: Demi

reviews.text: Kelly have  been to Haveli a few times now  and today was the first time Kelly would  been through the lunch buffet. Kelly have never been disappointed and today was no exception.  The staff are  as others say  extremely friendly and attentive. Every dish Kelly have  tried has fantastic flavor  and the servings are just right. The naan is chewy  the desserts sweet and the chai is tasty. They offer a wide range when it comes to level of spiciness  so Kelly m sure anyone can find the level that works for them. At the buffet they said everything was a   out of    and what Kelly had did not  seem to have much heat to it at all.  While this may not be my favorite Indian restaurant in town  it is definitely on the list  especially if meeting up with a friend for lunch in that part of town or for a convenient meal before a movie at AMC.
reviews.name: Kelly

reviews.text: The BEST INDIAN FOOD AND SERVICE in Madison. My husband and Antoinette LOVE coming here. Antoinette get the chicken curry with a little spice and it is  constantly amazing. Im a wimp when it comes to spiciness and they adjust the heat all the time. The service is top notch !  This place is. Family favorite !
reviews.name: Antoinette

reviews.text: Excellent lunch buffet !  There were plenty of different options  even four different dessert options . Buffet was warm and well stocked. The wait staff was friendly.   Yvette think it was less spicy than most Indian restaurants that Yvette have  tried but Yvette enjoyed that.
reviews.name: Yvette

reviews.text: Fantastic food. Amazing service. Cozy and quiet but perfect for a date or large group.
reviews.name: Matthew

reviews.text: Best Indian food in Madison !  Maddy get takeout all the time and it is  always delicious. The naan is so good -  - highly recommend the cheese naan !  And everyone there is so nice and welcoming. Definitely recommend !
reviews.name: Maddy

reviews.text: Very attentive service. Staff is so sweet !  They truly want you to have a great experience. Food was excellent with generous portions naan bread better than average. Ca not  wait to try the buffet on Sunday. Chris will be back !
reviews.name: Chris

reviews.text: Great service !  Their lunch buffet has lots of vegetarian options  which is great. Food is not  very spicy  which is a make or break for some  but it is  very flavorful.
reviews.name: Ania

reviews.text: My wife and jon recently were craving Indian food and this was one of the few Indian restaurants that jon had not checked out. jon do not  get out much these days with little kids at home so going new instead of tried and true is a risk. But this is a risk jon am glad jon took. The staff was exceptionally friendly and offered us just the right amount of attention. jon ordered the shrimp curry  tandoori mixed grill and some garlic naan. Everything was wonderfully spiced and the serving amounts were not small. jon walked out stuffed and with more than one meal worth of leftovers. jon would highly recommend this place.
reviews.name: jon

reviews.text: Best Indian Megan have  had in Madison. The shahi paneer is especially good. Megan typically prefer vegetarian options when ordering Indian food. Lentil dishes tend to be a bit over cooked. And the aloo ghobi lacks flavor. But there are lots of other good dishes to choose from. And whether you dine in or pick up takeout  there is  always great service.
reviews.name: Megan

reviews.text: Service is great  atmosphere is pleasant. My friend and Emily ordered one dish and one dessert  each -  - no drinks  water only .  The bill  with tip  was    .  Was it worth it  Yes  Emily think so.   The table was set with papadam and chutneys  and these chutneys tasted fresh and lovely. Emily shamelessly ate the rest of the green one with a spoon  it was so good. lol  Emily had the veggie korma. Emily judge all Indian restaurants by their veggie korma  and this was a standout  Emily thought. There was enough that Emily had to take some home  this will probably be the case here  so if you like the planet  Emily would  advise bringing your own to - go container .  The naan was soft and perfect  and did a great job of mopping up any errant korma sauce on my plate.  My friend ordered a vegetarian eggplant dish that neither of us recognized  and she was super happy with it. Emily tried a bite -  - YUM !   For dessert  she had the rice pudding  and Emily had the little fried cheese balls. Holy cow  they were tasty -  - a much deeper profile than donut holes  though they looked just like  em.  Emily was hoping they would  have the cottage cheese - like balls in cream  but alas  they did not. Still  Emily was thrilled with the consolation dish.  Emily will definitely come back  but because of the price  it probably wo not  be as often as Emily would  like.  Maybe a monthly treat.
reviews.name: Emily

reviews.text: This is our go - to Indian Restaurant in Madison  Fitchburg .  John especially like the lamb curry which John often pick up  -  only takes them    minutes to make and available in varying levels of spice.  Also includes delightful chutney relish sides.  Very nice.
reviews.name: John

reviews.text: This is not  one of my favorite restaurants for a couple of reasons. One  they do not have a lot of vegan options as other Indian restaurants have and second  all the other Indian restaurants Pri have been to in town give tandoori roti during lunch buffet but the staff was rude in straight away telling me that they wo not  make any adjustments. Pri felt he could have said it in a polite manner. That  why Pri do not  like going to this place. May be they do not  want vegan customers  :
reviews.name: Pri

reviews.text: Jackie love this place. Best indian buffet in the world. Usually with indian buffet some dishes do not  taste as fresh as they would be buying it as a meal on it is  own  but this is not the case here. The buffet is delicious all around. Spicy curries not lukewarm !  !   And briyani is always amazing. Highly recommend. Me and my boyfriend are regulars  the servers are very friendly and accomadting. They know us by our names and give us free ice cream and rice all the time. Make a stop for lunch buffet when you can !
reviews.name: Jackie

reviews.text: Extremely tasty homemade Indian fare served by the nicest staff you will  ever meet. Haveli offers an impressive selection while still surpassing expectations on classic menu staples. A nice first try at Haveli might include the Tandoori Mixed Grill  offering you the restaurant  take on tandoori chicken and shrimp  as well as seekh kabab. The friendly staff is will customize to your spice preference. The lunch buffet at   .   is a steal  and the all - you - can - eat fare is of the same quality as ordering off the menu. Definitely recommend.
reviews.name: Michael

reviews.text: Haveli has beautiful decorations. The service is prompt and friendly. The food is wonderful and has an excellent spice to it. Kelly have already been back here at least seven times . Thank you for coming to my neighborhood !
reviews.name: Kelly

reviews.text: Food is ok. No halal option and they seem to get annoyed if you ask  !  Mohammed used to go when they were nicer.
reviews.name: Mohammed

reviews.text: Matthew get take out from here every so often. Matthew really enjoy their masala curries and naan. Their lunch buffet is also of high quality. Hope this place sticks around !
reviews.name: Matthew

reviews.text: This restaurant is a jewel. Best food - it is  delicious. Best service - gracious and attentive. Best atmosphere - quiet and sophisticated. It is my new go to place for a great meal with family or friend. The food is fresh  delicately flavored and beautifully served. D. am very pleased to have a high quality Indian restaurant in Fitchburg. This is a great addition to our community.
reviews.name: D.

reviews.text: Haveli stayed open late for us and provided great service !  Their food is always amazing and the staff is incredibly friendly !
reviews.name: Laura

reviews.text: There goat meat curry is the best Gurwinder have  had in US and service is excellent too. Five star rating well deserved. Keep up the good work
reviews.name: Gurwinder

reviews.text: My wife and Matthew order from Haveli all the time  great service and fantastic food. There  a discount for paying in cash  and pickup orders are usually done in    -    minutes. The staff are very kind and friendly  and clearly prioritize customer satisfaction.   Matthew routinely get the lamb shahi korma  and my wife mixes it up. Matthew are both happy every time  -  me with the consistent dish and she with the consistent good taste. Matthew also frequently get plain lassis  and they are delicious !  Naan is very good too  have tried every one and love dipping them in our main courses !  !    If you like Indian food and are in the area  Matthew whole heartedly recommend Haveli. You wo not  be disappointed !
reviews.name: Matthew

reviews.text: Clean restaurant  friendly staff  and most importantly -  amazing food !  Sarah had the chicken tikka masala and lamb madras with garlic naan and it was very good !  This will definitely become a regular for me and my fianc  !
reviews.name: Sarah

reviews.text: Extremely gracious people run this place and the food is both authentic  abundant  fresh and just great.  Highly recommended for lunch and dinner !   M hope Haveli is successful here.
reviews.name: M

reviews.text: Jenee stopped in here with a young lady for a late lunch.  They had the lunch buffet which was perfect for both of us.  Jenee had a variety of main dishes and were pleased to see both mean and vegetarian options.  Despite catching the end of the lunch buffet the food was delicious and not over done as some warmed food can get.  There were two types of naan and a couple different chutney .  Jenee m glad there were not  a line of people at the buffet as the way it was organized did not  make for an easy line up for making a plate.  There were also a couple of dessert options as well as chicken soup.   The server checked in on us during the meal even though Jenee were just getting the buffet as Jenee ordered a drink mid - way through the meal.  Jenee was pleased that the price of the child buffet was based on the age as it was a good fit for what was eaten !   Jenee will go back for an evening meal the next time Jenee m in the neighborhood.
reviews.name: Jenee

reviews.text: This is the perfect addition to our Fitchburg dining pallet. Authentic Indian quisine in a nicely finished space that offers a blend of charm  class and friendly service.  The vast selection of foods will tickle your taste buds in ways no other local establishment can.  Home made breads  cheeses  curries  desserts and lovely drinks are but a few of the delights here.  This is a vegetarian  haven from their home kitchen !
reviews.name: Adam

reviews.text: Since Kimberly enjoyed lunch  Kimberly took my husband and daughter for the buffet on Sunday. All the staff were very kind to my daughter  and made us feel welcome to bring a   year old who does spontaneous song and dance. Since it was father  day   several more young families were enjoying their buffet as well. Kimberly m pretty sure they did not  charge us for a our kid -  Kimberly had   drinks and   adult buffet trips for    .  Short of having a toy area  this place was very kid friendly. Kimberly will be coming again !
reviews.name: Kimberly

reviews.text: Another great Indian restaurant in the Madison area !  Their service is particularly friendly and great  even compared to the other great Indian places around  Dhaba  Swad . Also  they have the best Indian buffet Alex have  had in Madison.
reviews.name: Alex

restaurants.name: Afghan Cuisine
restaurants.category: Restaurants, Ethnic Food, Pakistani, Halal, Food, Afghan, Specialty Food

reviews.text: Omg !  !  Service was reaaaally slow. It  a serve - yourself fast food place  but it took them    minutes to make a kebab combo !  The food was alright but very oily. The salad was just lettuce with a gross amount of Cole slaw dressing that got all over the meat and the rice  and quite frankly made half of the dish inedible. Sue A. m so disappointed. It  been a week of bad food for me  :
reviews.name: Sue A.

reviews.text: Very large and spacious restaurant with nice decor. Portions were large. Food was decent. Kind of weird that customers eat fast food style  no wait staff  since Afghan Cuisine is not fast food.
reviews.name: Sarah

reviews.text: Went in today with coworkers for lunch since in the past Lia had a good experience at this restaurant and food is good and affordable. But the service today was REALLY BAD !  A coworker of mine ordered a chicken wrap  Lia know for a fact that she ordered chicken since she was young she never ate BEEF because of her religion so there is no way in hell that she will ever order BEEF. So she got her wrap and she started eating it. Since its a wrap unless you disassemble it you would not know by the looks of it whether it was red or white meat inside so she took a bite and ate it. Never in her life she tasted beef so she ask us taste it since it tasted weird for her. So Lia disassembled the wrap at this point and tasted the meat inside it. It was beef !  !  !  !  !  At that point my coworker talked to the cashier and informed her that instead of giving her chicken  she gave her beef. Instead of apologizing  she raised her voice to my coworker and told her she made a mistake on her order which was not true at all. Unfortunately  Lia do not  have a proof since the receipt just says lunch special. She did not apologized   she did not even offer to give her a replacement. At this point my coworker even though clearly upset but hungry  ordered another chicken wrap despite us telling her not to do it and Lia can just transfer to another restaurant. Lia was well tempted to just really make a scene but Lia do not  want to stoop down to her level. The   of us and all other people that Lia know of swear never again to go back to this restaurant !   Lia understand that the reason that the cashier would have not  admitted her mistake was that it might end up that she foot the bill. But what Lia do not  understand is why she needs to raise her voice to my coworker.   A simple hint of humility could have been ok. If there is   stars  Lia will definitely give this place that. Also the beef tika Lia ordered this time around was dry. So food quality is not consistent.
reviews.name: Lia

reviews.text: Afghan Cuisine offers lunch special before   pm.  Tandoori Chicken Leg Kabob    .    which includes a pop sounded like a good value. Sadly the kabob tasted bland and dry.   The wait time for my lunch in an almost empty restaurant was long. Jennifer do appreciate how each order was made when order but    minute wait for a fast food like setting  Luckily Jennifer was not in a rush.  Jennifer do love the deco and spacious interior. Just wish the food could be better !
reviews.name: Jennifer

reviews.text: First time customer here. The ambiance is modern  there is a lot of money invested in renovation. The food Irina tried was good. Irina love Afghan pillow  and mostly came for it  it did not  disappoint. Stuff was patient with us as Irina did not  really know all the names for the dishes  so Irina just pointed to what people had and they explained what it was and how it was prepared. Good place to have a quick lunch or to order take out. The only minus was a salad  -  mostly shredded romaine lettuce with two bits of greenish tomato and mayo. Would stick to meat and rice next time.
reviews.name: Irina

reviews.text: Giselle like Afghan Cuisine a lot. It is a competitor to Bamiyan Kebab which is close by. Giselle think it is probably just as good. Giselle like to order the Chicken Korma which is  Giselle think   .   and comes with a chewy flatbread they call naan and some salsa - type stuff. The korma swims in a sea of grease and reminds me of Hungarian food.
reviews.name: Giselle

reviews.text: This is the first time Jeff have  tried Afghan cuisine and Jeff was happily surprised. Jeff ordered the chicken kabob lunch special    .    as an easy introduction to Afghan tastes. Perfectly cooked  juicy and nicely spiced. The rice tastes like it is  cooked with cinnamon  but when Jeff asked Jeff was told it is  not and that it is  a combination of afghan spices. The rice is really good. Salad was lightly dressed and refreshing. The hot sauce was excellent  not too hot and very flavourful.   This is not a fast food restaurant it seems that all the meats are cooked fresh. So have patience  Jeff think it is  worth the wait.  The restaurant is newly renovated  modern and very clean. There is lots of seating available with many booths.  Next time Jeff m going to be more adventurous order something Jeff have  never tried before.
reviews.name: Jeff

reviews.text: Not sure why this place is always empty  but Ryan have  been here a few times and the food is not  that bad.  It  not as great as Bamiyan Kebob  but still a good spot when hungry and in a rush.  Portion sizes are huge and very filling  with the Tandoori kebob being my favourite.  Staff are friendly.   If you have not  tried this place out  give it a shot next time you are  hungry.
reviews.name: Ryan

reviews.text: So the kabab karahi was good with the naan. Lamb shank was mostly good. My kid found it chewwy and not juicy enough. A pleasent place to sit and share food as there was lots of seating most of it empty. Food took abit more then    mins to prepare which felt longer then Foodie expected. Foodie didnt try desserts.   dishes were big enogh to share w   ppl.
reviews.name: Foodie

reviews.text: Food was ok. The service by the staff was really slow and the cook in the back was yelling constantly
reviews.name: Yusuf

reviews.text: Low quality food. Mamoun do not  know why Mamoun came here for the second time. Wo not  come again.
reviews.name: Mamoun

reviews.text: Used to like it at first. Now when Sarah go  the service is terrible. Mostly the mean women at the front. The young girls and cooks are nice. And few months ago Sarah found a hair in my rice. A different time the salad was ice cold  like literally ice in the salad and it was so soggy. Its still okay to go to in emergencies as they are open really late  but it is  a last resort
reviews.name: Sarah

reviews.text: Ordered take out and portions were extremely small. The containers were half filled and the chicken kebab dinner was so small it must have come from an anorexic chicken. Yohanna also ordered the vegetable stew  which was basically half a container full and filled with       of oil... Yuck. The bread was good  but one cannot survive on bread alone. The menu said that the dinners come with rice and salad  but never received any salads....rice was good and flavoured with a lot of cumin. Decor seemed nice and clean and the wait time for take out was minimal. Would Yohanna go back  Probably  but only if Yohanna was dieting and allowed minimal food.
reviews.name: Yohanna

reviews.text: After receiving a massage in the plaza Ogan dropped by for a quick bite.   First  this is not  a place where you MUST go. If Ogan was not in the area  or next time Ogan am in the area Ogan wo not  be returning.  Secondly  there is plenty of parking which is always good.  Lastly  the service was good as the ladies behind the counter are kind.  Ogan had the tandoori chicken and my date had the   types of chicken. The portions were loaded with rice and salad and a side of meat. Admittedly   Ogan do not  go to many afghan restaurants but Ogan struggled to find the identity as it resembles many falafel places but was missing the tahini sauces and the dips for the bread.  The chicken was the star of the meal  but you would be confused as it seems the rice is trying to take all the glory.  The bill came to about     for   meals and a yogurt drink. If you like yogurt you would love it.
reviews.name: Ogan

reviews.text: Thank God for this restaurant so close to my home...its become a staple for me. Khalid especially like their lamb shank  their beef tikkas  the rice and their naans  flatbread . The meat is cooked perfectly and neither under nor over spiced. The beef karahi was nowhere near as good as everything else they have...in fact...dont order the beef karahi...it misrepresents them. Yes  it does take quite a while to get your order but if you order in advance on the phone  it will save you the hassle of sitting around for    minutes and then you will  really appreciate the food. Khalid can not  imagine it would taste as good if they made it in much less time.
reviews.name: Khalid

reviews.text: The restaurant is clean and inviting. The food quality  quantity and taste is an  A  the meat is tender and juicy  the complimentary bread they give you is oven hot and yummy.
reviews.name: Ali

reviews.text: My first impression was how clean and well kept the restaurant was. The lady working there was helpful in answering our questions about the food. Everything was prepared quickly and came in large portions.  Silken ordered tandoori chicken and my boyfriend ordered the lamb shank.       for the lamb shank  it was super juicy and tender. Both dishes came with rice and salad. Silken liked the flavor of the rice and the hot sauce that came with was good too.
